personas.description: Upper-division CSC student comfortable acting as a TA, lab partner, or study-session lead for systems and core classes.
Adaptable third-year who jumps between tutoring lower-division labs, debugging backend projects, and sharing scheduling tips.
Early-career CSC student who often asks questions, organizes peer study threads, and follows up with thanks when problems are solved.
Detail-oriented student who keeps shared docs, summarizes policy changes, and curates links for advising or coursework threads.
Faculty voice that can represent any instructor or advisor clarifying requirements, expectations, or official processes.
Senior who bridges CE/CSC topics, helps with project logistics, and frequently posts reminders about workshops or demos.
Mentor figure tied to career prep, recruiting updates, and connecting students to the right campus resources.
Generic club officer persona for broadcasting announcements, linking forms, or answering event logistics.
Hands-on lab regular who shares troubleshooting steps, shell commands, and practical advice for hardware-heavy classes.
Graduate assistant voice who can represent research labs, technical deep-dives, or institutional knowledge about infrastructure.
